p: Wildlife and domestic animal disease caused by Giardia or Cryptosporidium are reportable to the OSV but is most likely under-reported by practitioners unfamiliar with regulation and animals are often treated clinically rather than diagnoses due to financial limitations. The prevalence of Cryptosporidium and Giardia spp. appears to be widespread among wildlife in Alaska ( 39, 40). Either boiling or filtering untreated surface water before drinking can prevent giardiasis and cryptosporidiosis. It is important to protect public water supplies against contamination with animal or human faeces and ensure adequate filtration of community water supplies.
